snippet: Marching in Selma, in 1965 and again this week, in the struggle for voting rights.
abstract: Editorial reflects on events of March 7, 1965, day known as Bloody Sunday, when civil rights activists were attacked by policemen as they were marching to support what would become Voting Rights Act; expresses hope that commemoration of event will remind Supreme Court justices of enormous cost many Americans have paid to win right to vote as they consider case regarding Section 5 of Voting Rights Act.
lead_paragraph: Marching in Selma, in 1965 and again this week, in the struggle for voting rights.
